com.google.calendar.interoperability.connectorplugin.base
Class InputScanner

java.lang.Object
  com.google.calendar.interoperability.connectorplugin.base.InputScanner

public class InputScanner
extends Object

Scans an inbound folder for incoming API messages and enqueues them into a sink. This object does not contain any threading logic -- its scan()-method needs to be invoked by an external process.

Constructor Summary
InputScanner(GwIo io, Sink<String> sink)
          Constructor.
 
Method Summary
 void scan()
          Scans the HEADERS_IN-folder for new files and puts them into the sink.
 void scanForever()
          This method will call the scan-method in an endless loop until the thread calling is interrupted.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

InputScanner

public InputScanner(GwIo io,
                    Sink<String> sink)
Constructor. Invoking this will not automatically start any threading on this object -- it is passive and needs to be triggered by calling the "scan"-method.

Method Detail

scan

public void scan()
Scans the HEADERS_IN-folder for new files and puts them into the sink.

scanForever

public void scanForever()
This method will call the scan-method in an endless loop until the thread calling is interrupted.
